poem:
Title: Lodz: A Land Promised

In the grey dawn of commerce,
Lodz trembles, a broken promise.
Men of wealth, once men of earth,
Trade whispers, claw at gold-dust.
 
Their hollow laughter echoes,
Bleak in the furnace-flame; the
Bitter aroma of burning futures,
Dark offering to an invisible god;

Silent cries of workers tossed
Upon the alter of their greed,
Washed in streams of spilled hope,
Avarice's cruel, unending opera.
